author: chfast
content: Because of the low availability today it make sense to cancel today's EOF call. cc <@642887713246150666>

author: draganrakita
content:
Need some clarification on `txcreate` (create4) and `eofcreate` (create3).
1. Does `eofcreate` do any verification and when?
2. In txcreate `validates the initcode container and all its subcontainers recursively`. when is this done? And as txcreate has access to tx initcodes, does those get validated?

author: gumb00
content:
1. not EOF validation, because this code was already validated when factory contract was deployed.
2. this is done by TXCREATE instruction after loading initcontainer from transaction and charging EIP-3860 charge for it

author: gumb00
content:
There're some new thoughts about exact order of checks in TXCREATE https://github.com/ethereum/evmone/pull/702/files#r1502720374
But so far evmone does validation after 3860 charge and before hashing charge

author: draganrakita
content: Aha i see eofcreate allows modifying the aux_data not creating new code. It loads code from container, executes it and calls `RETURNCONTRACT` to fill aux_data?

author: draganrakita
content: Does this mean that `container` in Eof body is in form of raw eof bytes or something else? How should i look at this

author: gumb00
content: Nested containers all must be valid EOF containers

author: draganrakita
content: I missed that. It is a lot clearer now. Thanks!

author: _shemnon
content: IIRC Subcontainers can actaully be short on data while a subcontainer, but must be full size when EOFCREATEed, so there is one (small) validation.

author: _shemnon
content: This is so that a contract can DATALOADN to something not hard coded, such as a ERC-20 contract, and wait for it to show up as aux_data.
